alert.note: Alert for Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:56PM CST until January 28 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Colorado River at Wharton affecting Matagorda and Wharton Counties. For the Colorado River...including Columbus, Wharton, Bay City, Matagorda...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Colorado River at Wharton. * WHEN...From late tonight to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 43.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage as numerous streets in west and southwest Wharton are inundated and the lowest homes threatened. The JDIN Recreational Center in southwest Wharton close to being isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 33.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 43.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 39.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 43.0 feet on 10/17/1957. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Colorado River Wharton 39.0 33.0 Thu 1 pm CST 42.4 40.5 24.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.Friday morning at 800 AM CST.
